Our Year of Reading

Celebrate and promote reading across Suffolk in 2016 and help us improve literacy, encourage reading for pleasure and remind everyone of the importance of reading.

Get involved – make a pledge and tell us why reading matters to you.

Make a reading pledge →

Author Nicola Upson on why she loves libraries:

"Reading has enriched my life from the moment my parents first took me to Bury St Edmunds Library as an inquisitive toddler of two or three, and I found out how far you could travel with a book in your hand. Stories are important." Read more authors on libraries and reading →

Get involved

Pledge

Make reading a pledge online or pick up a pledge postcard in a library.

#SuffolkYOR

You can use the hashtag #SuffolkYOR on Twitter and follow @SuffolkLibrary to keep in touch. We recently ran a competition to find the best #bookfacefriday and Get Caught Reading photos and we’ll be sharing some of the best ones soon!

What's on

Suffolk Writes

A pilot project to enable aspiring writers to get some of their work published as a library eBook which people can download from the library service.

Brave New Reads

A regional programme focusing on a list of six chosen books.

Summer Reading Challenge: The Big Friendly Read

The country’s biggest literacy programme aimed at children, based in libraries and growing in popularity every year. This is a great opportunity to encourage children to carry on reading through the holidays. Our libraries are looking for volunteers to help!

Literary festivals

Slaughter in Southwold crime writers’ festival

18-19 June in Southwold Library

Felixstowe Book Festival

25-26 June in Felixstowe Library

Suffolk Libraries Bookfest

21-30 October across the county of Suffolk

Lavenham Children’s Book Festival

Held in October

Lowestoft Library Literary Festival

Held in October

Ways with Words Literature Festival in Southwold

Held on 10-14 November

Our Year of Reading campaign is supported by the East Anglian Daily Times, BBC Radio Suffolk and Suffolk Magazine.
